column5: Catch myself my first muskie... or die valiantly trying haha.
An honest 24 inch Brook Trout. I've probably caught about 10 that were over 23, but haven't hit that magical 24" mark yet. That and to just have good times fishing with friends.
Well i would like to land a muskie over 40 inches and eat more fish
just to get out on the water more often, try out at least 2 new lakes I've never fished before
1.)  50"+ T.O. Pike 2.)  50"+ musky 3.)  7lb. smallie 4.)  flipper 5.)  Mermaid 6.)  Aquaman 7.)  All the lures I've donated to the depths
One just One Gbay muskie  tinbanger

All I'd like is to get out fishing more often, I barely got to wet a line last year  .  I think if that happens I'll reach my other goals of catching new spieces, or new personal bests.  I also hope to take my freinds boys fishing a few times and really get 'em "hooked"  Maureen
50 inch pike and musky are my toughest goals!
Actually that leads into my goal: Not pooping my pants when I see GCD's giganta fish

One more thing....Not sure if you can make this out. This yrs derby i pulled in a thousand dollar perch. Thats my mug on the bottom kissing the fish on the front page of our local paper.    So for the next derby i am gonna be trying for the  $2,500.
After being skunked this year for skis .. 1).  Get my wife her first musky. 2).  Break my PB of 43".  I just enjoy being out there, catching anything or not.

This year I want to catch my first St. Lawrence muskie. Got the Rideau and Ottawa River muskies figured out, but the Larry has been hard to crack.  From Lew: Crazyhook....you got a new boat???? Details please.....

For 2007 I just hope to continue to have the physical and financial health to fish as much as I like with the all of the same people I fished with this year. On top of that I would also like to meet twice as many new fishing buds this year as I did in 06. I have one other goal that is the same as last year I hope to watch my father get his first rainbow in long long time because we didn't get it done last year. Now if I could just convince him that at 71 he doesn't need to work 7 days a week it could actually happen too LOL.
PB pike.  Keep on getting out.

Its coming!!!! 4 years of rubing the wifes feet has finally paid off!  mind you last time I got the OK she was pregnant so 1. I will have a boat 2. I have a new baby!  LOL    a man after my own heart!  My resolution for 2007 is more glased and a few less Kreme filled!
2 Maybe 3 Trips Trout Fishing in Algonqiuin Park  Legal Muskie from the Lake my Cottage is on.  Lake Trout from the Lake my Cottage is on.
Less time on here and more out in the boat!

My 07 goals are short and sweet.... 50" plus ski 15lb eye to welcome my new child in to my life (somewhere to close for comfort to bass opener)  To find a Ottawa fishing partner as crazy as me, who works less than me, with a constant supply of gas/bait/munchies..... Hell since I'm dreaming...... If this someone just happens to have a 21' with a 250 verado it wouldn't be all that bad

I'll be spending time visiting some really nice people in NW Ontario.  We'll spend a lot of time on the water and the catching will take care of itself.  In May I'll share my boat with two special friends on the board that I'll  be meeting for the first time.

I'd like to spend more time on the water this year and go on at least one camping trip with my kids. I've been promising them we'll go, but something always comes up to throw a wrench in the plans. Did the tent in the yard thing, but they want to go fishing, wake up and see the boat waiting for you at the waters' edge kind of camping. I can't argue with that.
I'm aiming for the Lockness monster   , if not I'm going for any muskies over 50" on the bay.
I think I'm done
Damn, 76 days on the water is pretty good!  I'd like to fish more in 2007, catch another musky, catch a new species, and heck, why not, catch a pike or musky over 40".    Mike

I would like to be fishing on the reef where I normally do in late July/early August fishing walleye and see the world record muskie jump up for the third consecutive year.  (well he/she sure is a big one anyway  )
Nip, PM me with that exact spot I'll help you catch it.
just got a call from a friend in Florida  please add - Mako shark to my list!!
I just want to get out for musky more this year once it opens.. and have a good time.
i'd like to beat atleast one of my personal bests.
my goal is completed just to be with my family here in northeastern ontario where the ice is good and the fishing kicks ass pics to follow

1. Put my two fair weather fishing sons onto some nice fish at the French River in August and hopefully peak their interest in fishing a little more.  2. Land a Muskie at 7th annual FishGuts Fall Classic.

I have three goals this year; 1. Catch a Whitie through the ice... never tried it, looks like fun! 2. Catch a Laker through the ice... never tried it, looks like fun! 3. Catch a salmon/trout off a pier in the fall, tried it, only caught smallies! HH

Here are my goals....  1) Spend lots of family time with my wife and kids on nice spring/summer days/nights fishing. 2) Catch my first Salmon 3) Catch my first Muskie 4) Take a long weekend...rent a cabin on a lake...have a guide for the first day and then my wife and I the rest of the time on the water  In a similar thread earlier, I said I wanted to catch my first pike....but I did that last week
Post your goals for 07  20 muskies for me, at least one of them on the fly!  carp on the fly as well  - my first Billfish, bullshark over 150, first peacock bass as wel
For me it's all about kayak fishing. Last year I got 4 muskies in the yak, but all of them were under 36". I'd like a 40" plus in the yak, as well as a channel cat over 10lbs.
What weight is your anchor?

I guess my goals for 2007 ( fishing related )  would be to get out on the water more, try fishing new areas , and to get to know more of the fine people who frequent this board - whens the NEXT swill?!!!!   Happy New Year to all - and play safe tonight!!   Don
Buying a house in the heart of the Rideau lakes and exploring the fishing. Cant seem to get much information but it sounds like lots of bass and lakers.

Goals for 2007.I would like to catch a Muskie any size or a double digit pike.I would like to better my PB walleye of 11lbs 8oz in 2005 and again in 2006.Try to catch a land locked Salmon and a lake trout.Fish more with my boy who is eight and my Daughters 10 and 12.Have my wife Hypnotized so that she will like fishing.More camping more outdoors stuff.Mike

I have a trip to Nipigon PLanned for June so the 2 things i would like would be a 30pound plus Laker and a 6 pound plus spec. Closer to home I really would like to finally break the 20 pound mark on a brown. Oh and finally figure out easy end Erie eyes!
-Get out on Lake O. for Trout/Salmon more.  - Catch lots of Muskies,  and break 45" on my home waters.  -Go Bass fishing a few times at least.

My goal is the same as every year. To catch at least one fish that I am targetting on the day I am fishing, big or small, kept or released, does not matter. Targetting a fish I have never landed before is fine, but if I do not get one, oh well. There is always next time.

My only goal is to get out fishing more. I always have huge dreams about fishing here and there but time never allows it. So next year will hopefully be the year of fishing for me.  Also to conquer downrigger fishing and learn as much as I can about it.
To catch a fish so big... it'll make anybody that see's a pic of it poop their pants!!!
100 days on the water. same goal every year. I got closest in '06 with 74. damn you work/school.
To finally catch a Nippissing Musky!  To learn how to drive and dock the boat in case Paul "accidentally" falls overboard (with or without an anchor wrapped around his ankle  ).  Joey

my new years goal,is always the same  -go fishing as many times as i can -catch as many fish as i can -always try to beat my PB's for all species -fish as many new lakes and rivers that i can -meet as many OFC,members that i can [so far im doing good] -take my 2 fishergirls fishing as many times as i can -enjoy the sport of fishing,and all the scenry and wildlife thats around me  -and to always be learning new technics,and learning more & more everyday    cheers
Get out with fishin with more OFC'rs
have one goal--to catch an aurora trout
a BIG brown!  looks like I am gonna be doing a lot more open-water trolling for salmon trout & eyes & less time for bass/pike/muskie

Fish every weekend from the Walleye opener till closing and everyday i am on holidays. Try and fish Simcoe more and hook into a 7 Lbs. Smallie. Try and get out to the BOQ in the fall. Try Trout or Salmon fishing at least once.

I guess I'm one of the lucky ones who actually does get to fish as much as I want, and I spend an incredible amount of days on the water over the course of a musky season.  I don't usually set goals, then I'm never disappointed if I don't reach them, but rather just hit the water every day and try to have a good time, and if the fish gods smile on me, well then, it was a good day.    Two years ago I set a goal to help my daughter get her 1st musky, which she did, but setting that goal was an exception for me.  I've been very fortunate in the fact that I've shared my boat with more than 50 different OFNers over the last few years on musky trips and have made alot of good friends around here, and every year I hope to add a few more to the list.  Jamie, I guess the only real goal I've set for next year is to spend a couple days chasing those Ottawa River muskies with you like we've talked about so many times. I'll bring the Suicks and you supply the Dawgs and we'll see about getting that new boat of yours all slimed up
My goal for 2007 is to get out and fish more. And catch more fish haha.    jordan
beat all of my pb's from this year
I hope to get a Musky on a fly- haven't even tried it yet... I would like to finally get a Musky out of Blackstone/Woods Bay!
I would be happy with another year like 2006  If I could possibly top it that would be great!  Whopper
To get a steelie over 10lbs

Well my goal for 2007 would be to buy a nice log home nothing to big n fancy sat on a small island up north in the middle of  *(&*( no where    No neighbors at all.....Just me and nature  ohhh and a timmys coffe drop twice a week.....Gotta have me timmies...  ....lol..........Some where where i could just walk out my door  and drop a line in the water with out having to hitch up a boat or walk miles.....  But fat chance of that so i guess i will just have to setlle with a muskie.  Never caught one yet because i have never really fished for them. So 2007 i am hoping to catch a real nice one......
